document_title: Urinary incontinence: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention medications
subsection_content:
Depending on the level of urinary incontinence, the doctor will prescribe appropriate treatment methods to effectively improve the condition. Some possible methods include:
Medications to treat urinary incontinence: Some medications have the ability to reduce uncontrolled urine leakage, helping to stabilize contractions when the bladder is overactive. Commonly prescribed treatment drugs include: Oxybutynin, Oxybutynin XL, Oxybutynin TDDS, Tolterodine, Solifenacin, Fesoterodine, Darifenacin...; Control symptoms by making positive lifestyle changes and improving a healthy diet.; Botulinum injection: This method helps relax muscles, reducing urinary incontinence; Using an artificial urethral sphincter: This device is used for men, closing the urethra when not urinating, often used mainly after prostate cancer surgery.; Placing a urethral lift band: This is a highly effective method in treating stress urinary incontinence in women.
